Title: A modeling approach to describe ZVI-based anaerobic system
Authors: Xiao Xiao, Guo-Ping Sheng, Yang Mu, Han-Qing Yu
Abstract: Zero-valent iron (ZVI) is increasingly being added into anaerobic reactors to enhance the biological conversion of various less biodegradable pollutants (LBPs). Our study aimed to establish a new structure model based on the Anaerobic Digestion Model No. 1 (ADM1) to simulate such a ZVI-based anaerobic reactor. Three new processes, i.e., electron release from ZVI corrosion, H2 formation from ZVI corrosion, and transformation of LBPs, were integrated into ADM1. The established model was calibrated and tested using the experimental data from one published study, and validated using the data from another work. A good relationship between the predicted and measured results indicates that the proposed model was appropriate to describe the performance of the ZVI-based anaerobic system. Our model could provide more precise strategies for the design, development, and application of anaerobic systems especially for treating various LBPs-containing wastewaters.
GEMINI_What_problem_does_this_paper_atte:
- There is a lack of a structured mathematical model to simulate ZVI-based anaerobic systems for the treatment of less biodegradable pollutants (LBPs)-containing wastewater.
- It is necessary to integrate abiotic physicochemical processes (such as ZVI corrosion and $H_2$ production) with the biochemical processes in the existing Anaerobic Digestion Model No. 1 (ADM1).
GEMINI_How_the_paper_solves_this_problem:
- Developed a new structured mathematical model by extending the ADM1 framework.
- Integrated three new processes into the model: electron release from ZVI corrosion, $H_2$ formation from ZVI corrosion, and the transformation/degradation of LBPs.
- Incorporated the product toxicity of LBPs into the model to quantify the toxic effects of intermediate degradation products on microbial cell activity.
- Conducted a sensitivity analysis to identify the most critical parameters (e.g., $V_{m,Fe}$, $K_{s,Fe}$, $K_{P,Fe}$) affecting the system.
- Calibrated and validated the model using experimental data from two published studies (UASB reactors treating 3,4-DClNB and azo dye X-3B) via AQUASIM 2.0.
GEMINI_What_experiments_were_done_for_th:
- The paper itself is a mathematical modeling study and did not conduct new wet-lab experiments.
- It utilized experimental data from two previous studies for model calibration and validation:
  - Case I (Lin et al., 2011): A UASB reactor with 30 g/L ZVI treating 3,4-Dichloronitrobenzene (3,4-DClNB) and sucrose.
  - Case II (Zhang et al., 2012): A UASB reactor with a ZVI bed treating azo dye X-3B and sucrose.
- Conducted computer simulations and parameter estimation using AQUASIM 2.0.
- Performed sensitivity analysis on kinetic parameters ($V_{m,Fe}$, $K_{s,Fe}$, $K_{P,Fe}$).
GEMINI_What_are_the_points_that_can_be_e:
- Optimization of ZVI dosage and dosing frequency based on the identified sensitive parameters to reduce operational and capital costs.
- Application and validation of the model for other types of LBPs and different anaerobic reactor configurations.
- Further refinement of the model to account for non-ideal mixing conditions, as deviations were observed due to the lack of effluent recirculation in Case I.
- Investigation of the long-term effects of ZVI corrosion products (e.g., iron precipitates) on sludge activity and reactor hydrodynamics.
GEMINI_Summarize_the_main_points_of_the_:
- A novel mathematical model extending ADM1 was successfully developed to simulate ZVI-based anaerobic reactors.
- The model successfully integrates physicochemical processes (ZVI corrosion, $H_2$ release) with biological anaerobic digestion processes.
- Sensitivity analysis revealed that the promotion constant of ZVI ($K_{P,Fe}$) is highly relevant for predicting COD removal and $CH_4$ production.
- The model accurately simulated the degradation of specific LBPs (3,4-DClNB and azo dye X-3B) and overall reactor performance (COD, $CH_4$) when compared to experimental data.
- This modeling approach provides a theoretical foundation for designing and optimizing ZVI-enhanced anaerobic treatment systems.
GEMINI_What_are_the_relevant_studies:
- Batstone et al. (2012) Towards a generalized physicochemical framework.
- Batstone et al. (2002) The IWA anaerobic digestion model No 1 (ADM1).
- Bordeleau et al. (2011) Comprehensive review and compilation of pretreatments for mesophilic and thermophilic anaerobic digestion.
- Chatterjee et al. (2010) Removal of reactive black 5 by zero-valent iron modified with various surfactants.
- Farrell et al. (2000) Investigation of the long term performance of zero-valent iron for reductive dechlorination of trichloroethylene.
- Fedorovich et al. (2002) Extension of anaerobic digestion model no. 1 with processes of sulfate reduction.
- Ge et al. (2011) Temperature phased anaerobic digestion increases apparent hydrolysis rate for waste activated sludge.
- Hopkins et al. (1993) Trichloroethylene concentration effects on pilot field-scale in-situ groundwater bioremediation by phenol-oxidizing microorganisms.
- Hospido et al. (2010) Environmental assessment of anaerobically digested sludge reuse in agriculture: potential impacts of emerging micropollutants.
- Keum et al. (2004) Reduction of nitroaromatic pesticides with zero-valent iron.
- Klas et al. (2013) Advantages of low pH and limited oxygenation in arsenite removal from water by zero-valent iron.
- Lin et al. (2011) Reductive transformation and dechlorination of chloronitrobenzenes in UASB reactor enhanced with zero-valent iron addition.
- Ma et al. (2008) Enhanced biological treatment of industrial wastewater with bimetallic zero-valent iron.
- Moset et al. (2012) Process performance of anaerobic co-digestion of raw and acidified pig slurry.
- Ni et al. (2011) Coupling glucose fermentation and homoacetogenesis for elevated acetate production: experimental and mathematical approaches.
- Reichert et al. (1998) AQUASIM 2.0 User Manual.
- Shimada et al. (2011) Syntrophic acetate oxidation in two-phase (acid-methane) anaerobic digesters.
- Uzum et al. (2008) Application of zero-valent iron nanoparticles for the removal of aqueous $Co^{2+}$ ions under various experimental conditions.
- Xie et al. (2012) Influence of anionic cosolutes and pH on nanoscale zerovalent iron longevity: time scales and mechanisms of reactivity loss toward 1,1,1,2-tetrachloroethane and Cr(VI).
- Zhang et al. (2011) A built-in zero valent iron anaerobic reactor to enhance treatment of azo dye wastewater.
- Zhang et al. (2012) Steady performance of a zero valent iron packed anaerobic reactor for azo dye wastewater treatment under variable influent quality.
- Zhao et al. (2010) Dynamic modeling the anaerobic reactor startup process.
- Zhu et al. (2012) Effect of $H_2$ on reductive transformation of p-ClNB in a combined ZVI-anaerobic sludge system.
- Zonta et al. (2013) Modelling inhibitory effects of long chain fatty acids in the anaerobic digestion process.
zh_Abstract: 零价铁（ZVI）正越来越多地被添加到厌氧反应器中，以增强各种难降解污染物（LBPs）的生物转化。我们的研究旨在建立一个基于厌氧消化模型1号（ADM1）的新结构模型，以模拟这种基于ZVI的厌氧反应器。三个新过程，即ZVI腐蚀释放电子、ZVI腐蚀形成$H_2$以及LBPs的转化，被整合到ADM1中。使用一项已发表研究的实验数据对建立的模型进行了校准和测试，并使用另一项研究的数据进行了验证。预测结果与测量结果之间的良好相关性表明，所提出的模型适合描述基于ZVI的厌氧系统的性能。我们的模型可以为厌氧系统的设计、开发和应用提供更精确的策略，特别是用于处理各种含LBPs的废水。
GEMINI_zh_What_problem_does_this_paper_a:
- 缺乏一个结构化的数学模型来模拟用于处理含难降解污染物（LBPs）废水的零价铁（ZVI）强化厌氧系统。
- 需要将非生物的物理化学过程（如ZVI腐蚀、$H_2$的产生）与现有厌氧消化模型1号（ADM1）中的生化过程相结合。
GEMINI_zh_How_the_paper_solves_this_prob:
- 在ADM1框架的基础上开发了一个新的结构化数学模型。
- 将三个新过程整合到模型中：ZVI腐蚀释放电子、ZVI腐蚀产生$H_2$以及LBPs的转化和降解。
- 将LBPs的产物毒性纳入模型，以量化中间降解产物对微生物细胞活性的毒性影响。
- 进行了敏感性分析，以确定影响系统的最关键参数（例如 $V_{m,Fe}$, $K_{s,Fe}$, $K_{P,Fe}$）。
- 利用AQUASIM 2.0软件，使用两篇已发表文献（处理3,4-DClNB和偶氮染料X-3B的UASB反应器）的实验数据对模型进行了校准和验证。
GEMINI_zh_What_experiments_were_done_for:
- 本文是一项数学建模研究，未进行新的湿法实验。
- 利用了先前两项研究的实验数据进行模型的校准和验证：
  - 案例I（Lin et al., 2011）：添加30 g/L ZVI的UASB反应器，处理3,4-二氯硝基苯（3,4-DClNB）和蔗糖。
  - 案例II（Zhang et al., 2012）：装有ZVI床的UASB反应器，处理偶氮染料X-3B和蔗糖。
- 使用AQUASIM 2.0进行了计算机模拟和参数估算。
- 对动力学参数（$V_{m,Fe}$, $K_{s,Fe}$, $K_{P,Fe}$）进行了敏感性分析。
GEMINI_zh_What_are_the_points_that_can_b:
- 基于识别出的敏感参数，优化ZVI的投加量和投加频率，以降低运行和资本成本。
- 将该模型应用并验证于其他类型的难降解污染物（LBPs）和不同的厌氧反应器构型。
- 进一步完善模型以考虑非理想混合条件，因为在案例I中由于缺乏出水回流而观察到了偏差。
- 研究ZVI腐蚀产物（如铁沉淀物）对污泥活性和反应器流体力学的长期影响。
GEMINI_zh_Summarize_the_main_points_of_t:
- 成功开发了一种扩展ADM1的新型数学模型，用于模拟ZVI强化的厌氧反应器。
- 该模型成功地将物理化学过程（ZVI腐蚀、$H_2$释放）与生物厌氧消化过程结合起来。
- 敏感性分析表明，ZVI的促进常数（$K_{P,Fe}$）与预测COD去除率和$CH_4$产量具有极高的相关性。
- 与实验数据相比，该模型准确地模拟了特定LBPs（3,4-DClNB和偶氮染料X-3B）的降解以及反应器的整体性能（COD、$CH_4$）。
- 该建模方法为设计和优化ZVI强化的厌氧处理系统提供了理论基础。

- Xie et al. (2012) Influence of anionic cosolutes and pH on nanoscale zerovalent iron longevity: time scales and mechanisms of reactivity loss toward 1,1,1,2-tetrachloroethane and Cr(VI).
- Zhang et al. (2011) A built-in zero valent iron anaerobic reactor to enhance treatment of azo dye wastewater.
- Zhang et al. (2012) Steady performance of a zero valent iron packed anaerobic reactor for azo dye wastewater treatment under variable influent quality.
- Zhao et al. (2010) Dynamic modeling the anaerobic reactor startup process.
- Zhu et al. (2012) Effect of $H_2$ on reductive transformation of p-ClNB in a combined ZVI-anaerobic sludge system.
